page.title: 07FARMING-NEAR BOGNOR REGIS
page.content: This farm covers 450 acres and includes Lagness,Neals and Crimsham Manor Farms.Winter wheat,oats,spring barley,rape and peas are being grown.Crops are rotated each year to keep the soil fertile.Fertilizers, natural if possible, are also used.The farms machinery includes 2 tractors, plough, cultivator,sprayer, combine harvester,combine drill and dung spreader.Harvesting usually begins on 11th August.The grain is cleaned dried,and sold or stored in the farms silos until the price is higher.The farmer keeps a few horses,3 goats and about 50 chickens. Eggs are sold at the door.Fresh chickens and turkeys are sold at Christmas.20 years ago the farm had 33 workers.Now it has only 3,as more machinery is used.
